content.body: Is it specced that adding a fetch event listener in the service worker after first run will do something weird? https://dom.spec.whatwg.org/#add-an-event-listener just says "might not have expected results" but I can't find any spec mechanism that could generate those wrong results.
Ah I think I found it: https://w3c.github.io/ServiceWorker/#run-service-worker-algorithm step 17.1
Domenic: yeah, service workers violates the don't look at events thingie :-/
content.formatted_body: Domenic: yeah, service workers violates the don't look at events thingie :-/

content.body: I've come to peace with it, service workers are weird.
Domenic: did you have a chance to look at https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/pull/38150 again?
content.formatted_body: Domenic: did you have a chance to look at https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/pull/38150 again?

content.body: Domenic: I also found that we have `url-setters-stripping.any.js` which might make some of these a bit redundant
content.formatted_body: Domenic: I also found that we have url-setters-stripping.any.js which might make some of these a bit redundant

content.body: Hey all. I built a toy a while ago: https://foolip.github.io/spec-reactions/
Sorting by recent reactions and filtering to WHATWG gives this:

> <@annevk:matrix.org> Domenic: did you have a chance to look at https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/pull/38150 again?

I did not sadly; I am content with the new tests but I do wish I had time to investigate why we were passing before.
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @annevk:matrix.org
Domenic: did you have a chance to look at https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/pull/38150 again?
I did not sadly; I am content with the new tests but I do wish I had time to investigate why we were passing before.

content.body: Does that seem like it could correspond with things that are worth extra attention?
I like it, foolip! I've been rooting for observables in particular for some time :)
Ah yes, https://github.com/whatwg/dom/issues/544 wins the total reactions battle, but seems to have fallen quite lately.
Domenic: I'm going to merge to not block other implementers (and given the other existing tests); I can file an issue on jsdom if you want?
content.formatted_body: Domenic: I'm going to merge to not block other implementers (and given the other existing tests); I can file an issue on jsdom if you want?

content.body: Sounds good, and yeah a tracking issue would be quite lovely.

annevk: What is supposed to make the iframes not inherit UTF-8 from the same-origin parent harness in WebKit and Blink in https://wpt.fyi/results/encoding/unsupported-labels.window.html?label=experimental&label=master&aligned&view=subtest ?
